RECORD.TEXT: 607405643 DH 7792871 914308 8746979 6/21/2003 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary Signed DIS Report Status : Signed DISCHARGE SUMMARY NAME : CHABEAYRE , SHELLTILI UNIT NUMBER : 634-54-03 ADMISSION DATE : 06/21/2003 DISCHARGE DATE : 06/22/2003 PRINCIPLE DIAGNOSIS : Atrioventricular nodal re-entrant tachycardia ( AVNRT ) . PRINCIPLE PROCEDURE : Radiofrequency ablation . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient is a 38 year old female , with longstanding history of palpitations , beginning in her early 20's . She states that the first episode occurred at the time of her first pregnancy , and since then she has had 2-3 episodes per year . At first , the episodes lasted only a few seconds to minutes , however , for the past couple of years , the episodes have become more sustained in duration . She is now here for a diagnostic electrophysiologic study and radiofrequency ablation . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : 1. History of Graves disease . Treated with radioactive iodine . She has been on Synthroid , for the same ; 2. History of endometrial cancer , 1994 , status post total abdominal hysterectomy , and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy . She was initially treated with replacement hormonal therapy , but she recently discontinued the therapy 3 weeks prior to her outpatient visit . MEDICATIONS : 1. Atenolol 25 mg PO qd ; 2. Celexa 40 mg PO qd ; 3. Levoxyl 1.37 mcg PO qd ; 4. Lipitor 10 mg PO qd . ALLERGIES : Penicillin . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : Blood pressure 110/70 , pulse 72 per minute . head , eyes , ears , nose , throat : benign . Lungs were clear to auscultation and percussion . Jugular venous pressure was 4 cm without hepatojugular reflux . Carotid upstrokes were 2+ without bruits . Lungs were clear to auscultation and percussion . Cardiac exam revealed normal S1 , physiologically split S2 , no evidence for an S3 , S4 , or murmur . The LV impulse was in the midclavicular line was not sustained . Abdominal exam was obese and nontender . There was no evidence of hepatosplenomegaly or ascites . Extremities revealed no clubbing , cyanosis , or edema . Femoral pulses were 1+ without bruits . Pedal pulses were 1+ . Neurologic exam was grossly intact . Electrocardiogram at the time of admission showed normal sinus rhythm with normal axis and intervals . Echocardiogram on February 19 , 2002 , which documented a structurally normal heart . The left ventricular ejection fraction was 72% . There were no obvious wall motion abnormalities , valvular abnormalities , and the right ventricle appeared normal . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was admitted on June 21 , and was taken to the Electrophysiology Laboratory , where she was found to have typical slow-fast AV nodal re-entrant tachycardia . She had a successful radiofrequency ablation with modification of the slow pathway performed . Following the procedure , the tachyarrhythmia could not be re-induced . The patient was kept in the hospital overnight on heparin , and discharged the following morning on Aspirin for 4 weeks . She has been asked to discontinue her Atenolol . She will follow up with Dr. Ellam Whipple , in the outpatient setting . MAA ALB , M.D. DICTATING FOR : Electronically Signed ELLAM STENANKOLANY WHIPPLE , M.D. 08/10/2003 12:23 _____________________________ ELLAM STENANKOLANY WHIPPLE , M.D. TR : dkm DD : 06/22/2003 TD : 06/25/2003 10:42 A 914308 cc : ELLAM STENANKOLANY WHIPPLE , M.D. ALA JESCSC , M.D. IPSTON HOSPITAL [ report_end ]
